trans-unit.source: Extend on-premises AlwaysOn Availability Groups to Azure
trans-unit.target: Extend on-premises AlwaysOn Availability Groups to Azure

trans-unit.source: This tutorial describes how to use the Add Replica wizard in SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS) to add an AlwaysOn Availability Group replica in Azure.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial describes how to use the Add Replica wizard in SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS) to add an AlwaysOn Availability Group replica in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Extend on-premises AlwaysOn Availability Groups to Azure
trans-unit.target: Extend on-premises AlwaysOn Availability Groups to Azure

trans-unit.source: AlwaysOn Availability Groups provide high availability for groups of database by adding secondary replicas.
trans-unit.target: AlwaysOn Availability Groups provide high availability for groups of database by adding secondary replicas.

trans-unit.source: These replicas allow failing over databases in case of a failure.
trans-unit.target: These replicas allow failing over databases in case of a failure.

trans-unit.source: In addition they can be used to offload read workloads or backup tasks.
trans-unit.target: In addition they can be used to offload read workloads or backup tasks.

trans-unit.source: You can extend on-premises Availability Groups to Microsoft Azure by provisioning one or more Azure VMs with SQL Server and then adding them as replicas to your on-premises Availability Groups.
trans-unit.target: You can extend on-premises Availability Groups to Microsoft Azure by provisioning one or more Azure VMs with SQL Server and then adding them as replicas to your on-premises Availability Groups.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial assumes you have the following:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial assumes you have the following:

trans-unit.source: An active Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An active Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: You can [sign up for a free trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial).
trans-unit.target: You can [sign up for a free trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial).

trans-unit.source: An existing AlwaysOn Availability Group on-premises.
trans-unit.target: An existing AlwaysOn Availability Group on-premises.

trans-unit.source: For more information on Availability Groups, see [AlwaysOn Availability Groups](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/hh510230.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information on Availability Groups, see [AlwaysOn Availability Groups](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/hh510230.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Connectivity between the on-premises network and your Azure virtual network.
trans-unit.target: Connectivity between the on-premises network and your Azure virtual network.

trans-unit.source: For more information about creating this virtual network, see [Configure a Site-to-Site VPN in the Management Portal](../vpn-gateway/vpn-gateway-site-to-site-create.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about creating this virtual network, see [Configure a Site-to-Site VPN in the Management Portal](../vpn-gateway/vpn-gateway-site-to-site-create.md).

trans-unit.source: Add Azure Replica Wizard
trans-unit.target: Add Azure Replica Wizard

trans-unit.source: This section shows you how to use the **Add Azure Replica Wizard** to extend your AlwaysOn Availability Group solution to include Azure replicas.
trans-unit.target: This section shows you how to use the **Add Azure Replica Wizard** to extend your AlwaysOn Availability Group solution to include Azure replicas.

trans-unit.source: From within SQL Server Management Studio, expand **AlwaysOn High Availability** > **Availability Groups** > **[Name of your Availability Group]**.
trans-unit.target: From within SQL Server Management Studio, expand **AlwaysOn High Availability** > **Availability Groups** > **[Name of your Availability Group]**.

trans-unit.source: Right-click **Availability Replicas**, then click **Add Replica**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click **Availability Replicas**, then click **Add Replica**.

trans-unit.source: By default, the **Add Replica to Availability Group Wizard** is displayed.
trans-unit.target: By default, the **Add Replica to Availability Group Wizard** is displayed.

trans-unit.source: Click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: If you have selected the **Do not show this page again** option at the bottom of the page during a previous launch of this wizard, this screen will not be displayed.
trans-unit.target: If you have selected the **Do not show this page again** option at the bottom of the page during a previous launch of this wizard, this screen will not be displayed.

trans-unit.source: SQL
trans-unit.target: SQL

trans-unit.source: You will be required to connect to all existing secondary replicas.
trans-unit.target: You will be required to connect to all existing secondary replicas.

trans-unit.source: You can click on **Connect…** beside each replica or you can click **Connect All…** at the bottom of the screen.
trans-unit.target: You can click on **Connect…** beside each replica or you can click **Connect All…** at the bottom of the screen.

trans-unit.source: After authentication, click **Next** to advance to the next screen.
trans-unit.target: After authentication, click **Next** to advance to the next screen.

trans-unit.source: On the **Specify Replicas** page, multiple tabs are listed across the top: **Replicas**, **Endpoints**, **Backup Preferences**, and **Listener**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Specify Replicas** page, multiple tabs are listed across the top: **Replicas**, **Endpoints**, **Backup Preferences**, and **Listener**.

trans-unit.source: From the **Replicas** tab, click **Add Azure Replica…** to launch the Add Azure Replica Wizard.
trans-unit.target: From the **Replicas** tab, click **Add Azure Replica…** to launch the Add Azure Replica Wizard.

trans-unit.source: SQL
trans-unit.target: SQL

trans-unit.source: Select an existing Azure Management Certificate from the local Windows certificate store if you have installed one before.
trans-unit.target: Select an existing Azure Management Certificate from the local Windows certificate store if you have installed one before.

trans-unit.source: Select or enter the id of an Azure subscription if you have used one before.
trans-unit.target: Select or enter the id of an Azure subscription if you have used one before.

trans-unit.source: You can click Download to download and install an Azure Management Certificate and download the list of subscriptions using an Azure account.
trans-unit.target: You can click Download to download and install an Azure Management Certificate and download the list of subscriptions using an Azure account.

trans-unit.source: SQL
trans-unit.target: SQL

trans-unit.source: You will populate each field on the page with values that will be used to create the Azure Virtual Machine (VM) that will host the replica.
trans-unit.target: You will populate each field on the page with values that will be used to create the Azure Virtual Machine (VM) that will host the replica.

trans-unit.source: |Setting|Description|
trans-unit.target: |Setting|Description|

trans-unit.source: |**Image**|Select the desired combination of OS and SQL Server|
trans-unit.target: |**Image**|Select the desired combination of OS and SQL Server|

trans-unit.source: |**VM Size**|Select the size of VM that best suits your business needs|
trans-unit.target: |**VM Size**|Select the size of VM that best suits your business needs|

trans-unit.source: |**VM Name**|Specify a unique name for the new VM.
trans-unit.target: |**VM Name**|Specify a unique name for the new VM.

trans-unit.source: The name must contain between 3 and 15 characters, can contain only letters, numbers, and hyphens, and must start with a letter and end with either a letter or number.|
trans-unit.target: The name must contain between 3 and 15 characters, can contain only letters, numbers, and hyphens, and must start with a letter and end with either a letter or number.|

trans-unit.source: |**VM Username**|Specify a user name that will become the administrator account on the VM|
trans-unit.target: |**VM Username**|Specify a user name that will become the administrator account on the VM|

trans-unit.source: |**VM Administrator Password**|Specify a password for the new account|
trans-unit.target: |**VM Administrator Password**|Specify a password for the new account|

trans-unit.source: |**Confirm Password**|Confirm the password of the new account|
trans-unit.target: |**Confirm Password**|Confirm the password of the new account|

trans-unit.source: |**Virtual Network**|Specify the Azure virtual network that the new VM should use.
trans-unit.target: |**Virtual Network**|Specify the Azure virtual network that the new VM should use.

trans-unit.source: For more information on virtual networks, see [Virtual Network Overview](..\virtual-network\virtual-networks-overview.md).|
trans-unit.target: For more information on virtual networks, see [Virtual Network Overview](..\virtual-network\virtual-networks-overview.md).|

trans-unit.source: |**Virtual Network Subnet**|Specify the virtual network subnet that the new VM should use|
trans-unit.target: |**Virtual Network Subnet**|Specify the virtual network subnet that the new VM should use|

trans-unit.source: |**Domain**|Confirm the pre-populated value for the domain is correct|
trans-unit.target: |**Domain**|Confirm the pre-populated value for the domain is correct|

trans-unit.source: |**Domain User Name**|Specify an account that is in the local administrators group on the local cluster nodes|
trans-unit.target: |**Domain User Name**|Specify an account that is in the local administrators group on the local cluster nodes|

trans-unit.source: |**Password**|Specify the password for the domain user name|
trans-unit.target: |**Password**|Specify the password for the domain user name|

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to validate the deployment settings.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to validate the deployment settings.

trans-unit.source: Legal terms are displayed next.
trans-unit.target: Legal terms are displayed next.

trans-unit.source: Read and click **OK** if you agree to these terms.
trans-unit.target: Read and click **OK** if you agree to these terms.

trans-unit.source: The **Specify Replicas** page is displayed again.
trans-unit.target: The **Specify Replicas** page is displayed again.

trans-unit.source: Verify the settings for the new Azure replica on the **Replicas**, **Endpoints**, and **Backup Preferences** tabs.
trans-unit.target: Verify the settings for the new Azure replica on the **Replicas**, **Endpoints**, and **Backup Preferences** tabs.

trans-unit.source: Modify settings to meet your business requirements.
trans-unit.target: Modify settings to meet your business requirements.

trans-unit.source: For more information on the parameters contained on these tabs, see [Specify Replicas Page (New Availability Group Wizard/Add Replica Wizard)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/hh213088.aspx).Note that listeners cannot be created using the Listener tab for Availability Groups that contain Azure replicas.
trans-unit.target: For more information on the parameters contained on these tabs, see [Specify Replicas Page (New Availability Group Wizard/Add Replica Wizard)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/hh213088.aspx).Note that listeners cannot be created using the Listener tab for Availability Groups that contain Azure replicas.

trans-unit.source: In addition, if a listener has already been created prior to launching the Wizard, you will receive a message indicating that it is not supported in Azure.
trans-unit.target: In addition, if a listener has already been created prior to launching the Wizard, you will receive a message indicating that it is not supported in Azure.

trans-unit.source: We will look at how to create listeners in the **Create an Availability Group Listener** section.
trans-unit.target: We will look at how to create listeners in the **Create an Availability Group Listener** section.

trans-unit.source: SQL
trans-unit.target: SQL

trans-unit.source: Click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Select the data synchronization method you want to use on the **Select Initial Data Synchronization** page and click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Select the data synchronization method you want to use on the **Select Initial Data Synchronization** page and click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: For most scenarios, select **Full Data Synchronization**.
trans-unit.target: For most scenarios, select **Full Data Synchronization**.

trans-unit.source: For more information on data synchronization methods, see [Select Initial Data Synchronization Page (AlwaysOn Availability Group Wizards)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/hh231021.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information on data synchronization methods, see [Select Initial Data Synchronization Page (AlwaysOn Availability Group Wizards)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/hh231021.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Review the results on the **Validation** page.
trans-unit.target: Review the results on the **Validation** page.

trans-unit.source: Correct outstanding issues and re-run the validation if necessary.
trans-unit.target: Correct outstanding issues and re-run the validation if necessary.

trans-unit.source: Click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: SQL
trans-unit.target: SQL

trans-unit.source: Review the settings on the **Summary** page, then click **Finish**.
trans-unit.target: Review the settings on the **Summary** page, then click **Finish**.

trans-unit.source: The provisioning process begins.
trans-unit.target: The provisioning process begins.

trans-unit.source: When the wizard completes successfully, click **Close** to exit out of the wizard.
trans-unit.target: When the wizard completes successfully, click **Close** to exit out of the wizard.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The Add Azure Replica Wizard creates a log file in
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The Add Azure Replica Wizard creates a log file in

trans-unit.source: \<user name>\AppData\Local\SQL Server\AddReplicaWizard.
trans-unit.target: \<user name>\AppData\Local\SQL Server\AddReplicaWizard.

trans-unit.source: This log file can be used to troubleshoot failed Azure replica deployments.
trans-unit.target: This log file can be used to troubleshoot failed Azure replica deployments.

trans-unit.source: If the Wizard fails executing any action, all previous operations are rolled back, including deleting the provisioned VM.
trans-unit.target: If the Wizard fails executing any action, all previous operations are rolled back, including deleting the provisioned VM.

trans-unit.source: Create an Availability Group Listener
trans-unit.target: Create an Availability Group Listener

trans-unit.source: After the availability group has been created, you should create a listener for clients to connect to the replicas.
trans-unit.target: After the availability group has been created, you should create a listener for clients to connect to the replicas.

trans-unit.source: Listeners direct incoming connections to either the primary or a read-only secondary replica.
trans-unit.target: Listeners direct incoming connections to either the primary or a read-only secondary replica.

trans-unit.source: For more information on listeners, see [Configure an ILB listener for AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure](virtual-machines-sql-server-configure-ilb-alwayson-availability-group-listener.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on listeners, see [Configure an ILB listener for AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure](virtual-machines-sql-server-configure-ilb-alwayson-availability-group-listener.md).

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: In addition to using the **Add Azure Replica Wizard** to extend your AlwaysOn Availability Group to Azure, you might also move some SQL Server workloads completely to Azure.
trans-unit.target: In addition to using the **Add Azure Replica Wizard** to extend your AlwaysOn Availability Group to Azure, you might also move some SQL Server workloads completely to Azure.

trans-unit.source: To get started, see [Provisioning a SQL Server Virtual Machine on Azure](virtual-machines-provision-sql-server.md).
trans-unit.target: To get started, see [Provisioning a SQL Server Virtual Machine on Azure](virtual-machines-provision-sql-server.md).

trans-unit.source: For other topics related to running SQL Server in Azure VMs, see [SQL Server on Azure Virtual Machines](virtual-machines-sql-server-infrastructure-services.md).
trans-unit.target: For other topics related to running SQL Server in Azure VMs, see [SQL Server on Azure Virtual Machines](virtual-machines-sql-server-infrastructure-services.md).
